item.title:
Join us on Tuesday, May 30 for an interactive LLM workshop!
Learn how to take an off-the-shelf LLM that has been fine-tuned on a set of instructions and use it to create powerful AI applications using custom input-output fine-tuning approaches.
RSVP: https://t.co/FXbYXMyYfy https://t.co/L1R6rREZPo

item.title:
My pet peeve on weather apps: What does "50% chance of rain" mean?
Does it mean:
(A) 50% chance it will rain at some point (for maybe an hour) at some point during the day (like a passing thunderstorm)?
(B) 50% chance it will rain all day?
These are pretty different https://t.co/Ve9I32niMY

item.title:
@TonyZador Precipitation probability is one of those crazy norms. It‚Äôs basically the forecaster‚Äôs certainty that precipitation will form or move into the area weighted by areal coverage of precipitation that is expected.
P = c*a

item.title:
This is sadly super common. My advice to anyone *hoping* to attend any conference: apply for a visa before you even know if you'll go!
If you're a trainee, ask your supervisor if they can cover the cost of the visa even in the event you can't go (e.g. your poster is rejected). https://t.co/gGby8Lulab
